benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/customFields - Remove custom fields from bundle

covered: DELETE | Valid Deletion: Thorough coverage of success paths (remove all, single, multiple, none present) returning 204, with post-verification via GET and unaffected bundles.
DELETE | Non-Existent Resource: 404 for unknown bundle and empty database states.
DELETE | Concurrency: Simultaneous deletes of the same custom field validated as idempotent with 204.
Validation and Query Handling: Invalid bundleId/UUID formats, truncated UUIDs, empty customField, unsupported query params (ignored), and multi-valued customField covered.
Headers and Auth: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced; optional Reason/Comment supported; 401 for invalid token; 400 for missing required header; header value length boundaries for Comment.

Resilience/Security/Perf: 503/504 when services are unavailable/degraded; SQL injection attempt in CreatedBy blocked; large-scale delete performance target validated; data consistency validated post-delete.
gaps: DELETE | Soft Deletes: No scenario to confirm whether deletion is soft vs hard (e.g., audit flags vs physical removal).
Concurrency breadth: No test for concurrent mixed operations (one deleting all while another deletes a subset) or immediate retry idempotency (same request twice sequentially).
Mixed customField values: No scenario with a mixture of valid and invalid UUIDs in the same request to define whole-request vs partial-failure behavior.
Duplicate customField IDs in the same request are not tested (should still succeed and be idempotent).
Cross-bundle reference: Not tested when a provided customField UUID belongs to a different bundle (should not affect that bundle and should not remove anything from the target bundle).
Response semantics: No explicit checks that 204 responses have an empty body and appropriate headers; and that error responses return application/json as per spec.
Authorization depth: 403 (authenticated but not authorized) not covered, if applicable.
Operational limits: No rate limiting (429) coverage and no explicit 500 Internal Server Error handling for unexpected backend failures.
Header robustness: No injection/boundary tests for X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment beyond length; no CreatedBy boundary/Unicode tests.
Protocol correctness: No test sending an unexpected request body or wrong Content-Type to confirm server behavior (ignored vs 415).
recommendations: Add a test to determine deletion model: validate soft-delete vs hard-delete behavior, e.g., verify audit markers or presence in an audit/history endpoint.

Extend concurrency coverage with: (a) delete-all vs delete-subset issued simultaneously; (b) immediate retry of the same delete to assert idempotent 204; (c) simultaneous deletes of different fields where one request completes first.
Add scenarios for mixed customField inputs: one invalid UUID alongside valid ones (expect 400 vs partial success); combine valid-but-not-on-bundle with valid-on-bundle.
Add a test with duplicate customField UUIDs in the same request to ensure idempotent behavior and a single effective removal.
Test cross-bundle UUIDs: include a custom field that belongs to another bundle in the request and verify it is not removed from that other bundle and the target bundle remains consistent.
Verify response semantics: assert 204 has no body and appropriate headers; assert error responses carry Content-Type application/json and a consistent error schema.
If applicable, add a 403 authorization scenario (authenticated user lacking permission).
Add resilience/ops tests for 429 rate limiting and forced 500 Internal Server Error to validate generic failure handling.
Expand header robustness: injection and boundary tests for Reason/Comment; boundary and Unicode tests for CreatedBy.
Add a negative protocol test sending an unexpected body or incorrect Content-Type to confirm server behavior (ignore vs 415).
